entities: UN Panel of Experts on Liberia
summary:
The Security Council, recalling its previous resolutions on Liberia, welcomes the progress made by the Government of Liberia in rebuilding the country. The Council commends the work of the Committee and the Panel of Experts established under resolution 1521 (2003) and notes the positive role of targeted measures in supporting Liberia's stabilization. 

The Council stresses that lasting stability in Liberia requires the Government to sustain effective and accountable government institutions, particularly in the rule of law and security sectors. It underlines the importance of the transparent and effective management of natural resources for Liberia's sustainable peace and security.

The Council, acting under Chapter VII of the Charter, decides to terminate, with immediate effect, the measures on arms previously imposed by resolution 1521 (2003) and its modifications. 

The Council also decides to dissolve, with immediate effect, the Committee established by resolution 1521 (2003) and the Panel of Experts.
